tp:treatment-sec.p:
The specific epithet ‘
tuberculata
’ refers to the shell sculpture consisting of numerous tiny tubercles ( Fig. 4B ).

Holotype THAILAND • shell (SH = 9.6 mm , SW = 14.4 mm , AH = 5.2 mm , AW = 5.5 mm , UW = 3.5 mm ); Loei Province , Phu Rua District , Wat Thepnimit ; 17°26′15.09″ N , 101°16′41.46″ E ; alt.
647 m
;
23 Sep. 2017
; B. Nahok , K. Tanmuangpak and U. Chanlabut leg.; NHMSU-00025 . ( Fig. 3B )

Paratypes THAILAND • 10 shells , 7 living specs ; same collection data as for holotype; GenBank No. MN449402 and MZ435747 ; NHMSU-00026
.

GENITAL SYSTEM (n = 3) ( Fig. 5B , Table 4 ). Penis cylindrical, swollen in the middle part, internally with rather wavy, corrugated longitudinal pilasters and a short, hollow verge with 2–3 lobes around its opening. Epiphallus evenly cylindrical, as long as penis. Flagellum like a short protrusion with a pointed tip, without nodes, internally with longitudinal slender pilasters. Vas deferens cylindrical, narrow, entering in the lower half of the flagellum. Vagina relatively short, internally with five corrugated longitudinal pilasters. Free oviduct very short. Gametolytic sac slightly thicker at base, with a long, narrow and thin cylindrical tube, and at its distal end a small, swollen spherical sac. Prostate gland very long. Uterus long and thin.

from northeastern Thailand. A .

L. diplogramma ( Möllendorff, 1902 )
comb. nov. Scale bars = 10 mm.

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Landouria tuberculata
sp. nov. differs from other Thai species of
Landouria
, by the shell sculpture of numerous tiny tubercles ( Fig. 4B ). Lateral teeth of radula bicuspid and lanceolate ( Fig. 6D–E ).

Landouria tuberculata
sp. nov. is currently only known from the area surrounding Phu Rua National Park, Phu Rua District, Loei Province , Thailand .
